alert.note: Alert for Big Hole Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 16 at 3:41AM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, snow and wind expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches, with locally higher amounts above pass level. Winds gusting as high as 45 MPH. * WHERE...The Big Hole Mountains, including but not limited to Victor and Pine Creek Pass. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM this morning. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 11 PM this evening to 2 PM Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution. The latest road conditions can be obtained at 511.idaho.gov.
